body_html:
@nightrome Thanks for filing the issue! Unfortunately there isn't a simple fix to this problem with the existing input pipeline design. Currently the best advice is to always make sure you've started the queue runner.

I know this isn't satisfying; we don't like it either. That's the purpose of the referenced #7951 , which aims to simplify usage of input pipelines. We're actively working on this!

As for the freezing problem, please follow up on #7573 that you referenced. Thanks!

I'm closing this out. Please don't hesitate to file new issues, or follow up on this issue if I've overlooked something, and I'll re-open this issue.

I know this isn't satisfying; we don't like it either.  That's the purpose of the referenced #7951 , which aims to simplify usage of input pipelines.  We're actively working on this!
As for the freezing problem, please follow up on #7573 that you referenced.  Thanks!
I'm closing this out.  Please don't hesitate to file new issues, or follow up on this issue if I've overlooked something, and I'll re-open this issue.
body:
@nightrome Thanks for filing the issue!  Unfortunately there isn't a simple fix to this problem with the existing input pipeline design.  Currently the best advice is to always make sure you've started the queue runner.

I know this isn't satisfying; we don't like it either.  That's the purpose of the referenced #7951 , which aims to simplify usage of input pipelines.  We're actively working on this!

As for the freezing problem, please follow up on #7573 that you referenced.  Thanks!

I'm closing this out.  Please don't hesitate to file new issues, or follow up on this issue if I've overlooked something, and I'll re-open this issue.
